posts.post_content:
Offered here is a very sharp looking Cobb portrait. Graded a 1.5 by SGC mainly due to what looks liked a hand pressed letter of some kind. Bright colors, solid registration, and decent corners make this a perfect example of "buy the card not the grade" in my opinion. Have 2 other 06`s with same mark most likely from an old time collector. Please see enclosed scans and ask any questions via PM/email or post. 1`st "I`ll take it" is new owner. Asking XXXX net to me, through paypal. Ins priority shipping included. Thanx for looking............Murph
[url=https://flic.kr/p/2hXX5bX][img]https://live.staticflickr.com/65535/49203553363_dbe6477f90_c.jpg[/img][/url][url=https://flic.kr/p/2hXX5bX]T 206 Red Cobb Portrait,   SGC  1.5[/url] by [url=https://www.flickr.com/photos/154296763@N05/]Hugh Murphy[/url], on Flickr 
[url=https://flic.kr/p/2k3L62P][img]https://live.staticflickr.com/65535/50570705981_d249d5af1b_c.jpg[/img][/url][url=https://flic.kr/p/2k3L62P]Untitled[/url] by [url=https://www.flickr.com/photos/154296763@N05/]Hugh Murphy[/url], on Flickr
One week bump guys, any interest, offers ? Thanks again for looking.
Give this bad boy another shot here.......
Wish I had the funds! Would love to own one like this, in the future. Best of luck selling!

Beautiful Cobb Murph! Good luck with your sale!

-Bill
Thanks James, Bill for the kind words. Giving this Cobb a one month bump to gauge any interest. Thanx again for looking. 5 weeks until pitchers and catchers, we hope !!

Hello Murphy,

PM sent. You can reach me at [url]ablefts@yahoo.com[/url] also. Thanks Mike

Hey Guys, this beautiful Red Cobb portrait is still available.  Have had quite few looks and some inquiries  but as of yet, nothing finalized. Would be willing to  listen to cash/trade offers of interesting material. My main focus is Mantle/Babe/Black Sox. If you require additional scans that can be supersized, just go to my enclosed collection link. (tap on any photo) Thanx for looking....

Hugh,

Have you determined if that is an F Scott Fitz stamp? Or supposed F Scott.

I am not a stamp expert but it looks like one. Great looking card!

Peace, Mike

Hey Mike thanks for the response Sir. Not sure about the F Scott connection but it`s an interesting rumor for sure. Here`s 2 more 06`s I have with the exact same embossed stamp location and all. Pretty cool....
[url=https://flic.kr/p/2kuaMmR][img]https://live.staticflickr.com/65535/50858241621_6a5abd8f8a_z.jpg[/img][/url][url=https://flic.kr/p/2kuaMmR]Untitled[/url] by [url=https://www.flickr.com/photos/154296763@N05/]Hugh Murphy[/url], on Flickr
[url=https://flic.kr/p/2kuaLZU][img]https://live.staticflickr.com/65535/50858240406_de82e67667_z.jpg[/img][/url][url=https://flic.kr/p/2kuaLZU]Untitled[/url] by [url=https://www.flickr.com/photos/154296763@N05/]Hugh Murphy[/url], on Flickr
[url=https://flic.kr/p/2kuaLkn][img]https://live.staticflickr.com/65535/50858238171_dfcf7084b8_z.jpg[/img][/url][url=https://flic.kr/p/2kuaLkn]Untitled[/url] by [url=https://www.flickr.com/photos/154296763@N05/]Hugh Murphy[/url], on Flickr

Hugh,

I'd like to discuss Mr. Cobb! Please check your private messages!

Thanks! Mike

Murph,

Great conversing with you and yes, "I'll take it" , thanks and send me your paypal address and I'll pay tonite!

Peace, Mike

PS Just paid in full Hugh on paypal! Thanks again! mike

I love these boards! Thanks and big shoutout to Hugh for sending this beauty so quickly. He also included so much more (my camera not working great so I can't show) but suffice it to say that he sent a Ty Cobb book, an old Sports Americana, a 1915 newspaper with Joe Jackson story on front page, an original Campy snapshot, a cool old baseball postcard and on and on.....

Speechless! Thank you sooooooo much Hugh!! Wow!~!!!!@!


Peace and thanks! Mike

[IMG]http://www.net54baseball.com/attachment.php?attachmentid=437472&d=1611691105[/IMG]
My pleasure Mike, great to meet and converse with one of the true gentleman of the hobby. Thanx again Sir, all the best.
